subject: Public Speaking
title: Steve Jobs' Stanford Commencement
description: A 60-second lesson on Steve Jobs' Stanford Commencement.

hook.text: In 2005, Steve Jobs told Stanford graduates three personal stories. No slides, no product demos. Just stories.

buildup.text: He talked about dropping out of college, getting fired from Apple, and being diagnosed with cancer.

discovery.text: His lesson: connecting the dots only works looking backward. You have to trust the process going forward.

twist.text: He ended with stay hungry, stay foolish â€” a quote from someone else's magazine. Borrowed wisdom, perfectly placed.

climax.text: The speech became the most-watched commencement ever. Its power came from vulnerability, not authority.

punchline.text: The tech mogul's best product was a story.

quiz.question: Where did Jobs get the phrase 'stay hungry, stay foolish'?
